ActorTalk: There you are, Commandant.
I recently learned a new folding technique that makes the clovers more three-dimensional. When you use glossy paper, they sparkle in the sunlight. It's really pretty.
But the technique is pretty tricky, and I haven't quite mastered it yet. I was practicing just now during my free time.
Yes. How did you know, Commandant?
I've tried many times, but no matter how careful I was, something always felt off. But this one came out perfectly. It's the most beautiful clover I've ever folded.
Which means... maybe the clover's already brought a little luck, just by turning out the way it did.
It's for you, Commandant. I hope it brings you good luck.
(The terminal is still showing yesterday's date. Everything in the lounge has returned to how it was. Past events are happening again... It feels like I've fallen into a time loop.)
(What's happening now mirrors the plot of "Froggie's Day" exactly. Even the scenes from my dreams keep pointing to Froggie... Maybe the answer lies in that movie?)
("Sincere wishes bring about miracles"—that's the movie's main theme. If this loop follows the same rule, then maybe the way out lies in fulfilling someone's wish. But whose...?)
(Yesterday ended in a hurry. Lucia didn't say anything, but I could see the disappointment in her eyes. Maybe her wish right now... is simply to spend a full day with me together?)
...Is something on your mind, Commandant?
Is it related to the confusion you mentioned in your message earlier? If there's something troubling you, I'd like to help.
Oh, and ribbit, when we see Mama Mole, don't mention anything about the "loop."
Are you worried about something?
If Mama Mole finds out about the loop, her wish would become tainted with a desire to help Froggie.
Wish Dewdrops have to stay pure. If any conflicting feelings get mixed in, they'll cloud up and stop working.
(I shouldn't mention the time loop. If Lucia found out, she'd want to help me... and that might taint the purity of her wish.)
It's probably just the aftereffects of working too hard. My head's a little foggy—I even misremembered what we talked about.
I'd like you to decide what we do today, Lucia. If you have something you want to do, just say the word.
Something I want to do?
Oh... I heard Kowloong Restaurant has some new dishes. Maybe we can go try them later?
(Kowloong Restaurant gets insanely crowded around mealtime. I'd better make a reservation in advance.)
Sure, but it's still a bit early for food. Is there anywhere else you'd like to go in the meantime?
Somewhere I really want to go...
There is this one place, but...
...Please come with me, Commandant.
Is this your first time getting it right?
Nothing...
What do you want to do today?
It should be somewhere you really want to go.
That's fine. I'll go anywhere with you.
But what is it?
